hours_text:
We are Bruce Lee  
Due to the unexpected facilities maintenance in the Choy Gallery, the Chinese Laundries in the U.S exhibit will be temporarily closed to the public. [Buy Ticket __](https://buy.acmeticketing.com/orders/512/calendar) [Read more about this exhibit __](https://chsa.org/chinese-laundries-in-the-u-s/) Challenging a white-washed History CHINESE LAUNDRIES IN THE U.S.  [Donation __](https://www.paypal.com/donate/?hosted_button_id=LJ4TP4U73RTZE) Help support CHSA in promoting the history, culture and legacy of Chinese of America Support CHSA 

## **Beginning Monday, December 22, CHSA Museum will be temporarily closed due to necessary renovations to repair and upgrade our facilities and museum space.**

## **We sincerely apologize for any inconvenience this may cause and appreciate your understanding as we work to improve the museum experience of our staff, our visitors, and our greater community.**

## **This closure will remain in effect through January 2026. We anticipate opening the museum back up in mid-February and will remain communicative about any updates to the reopening timeline. ****In the meantime, our online gift shop will remain open throughout the temporary closure.**

accessibility_text:
## Accessibility

# CHSA visitor accessibility guide

All CHSA Museum galleries are fully wheelchair accessible by elevator. ADA entrance is located on Joice St. Ask for assistance at front desk and our staff would love to help.

# BUILDING HOURS

Wednesday – Sunday 11 AM – 4 PM

### **Days Closed**

New Years Day (January 1)   
Chinese Lunar New Year   
Martin Luther King, Jr. Day   
Presidents Day   
Memorial Day   
Independence Day   
Labor Day   
Thanksgiving   
Christmas Day   
New Years Eve (December 31)

# PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION

CHSA is located at 965 Clay St. Between Powell St and Stockton St.

### By Bus and Subway

Our facility is within one block from bus lines: 1 California, 30 Stockton.

### By Subway

Coming by subway, CHSA is 2 blocks away from the Rose Pak Central Subway line (station currently under construction).

### By Cable Car

Public Transportation by historic Cable Car is fun and easy. Did you know that Cable Cars are the only mobile national monument?

CHSA is conveniently located one block (downhill) from the Powell St. Cable car line. And 2 blocks away from the California St Cable Car line. Stop at Powell and walk to Clay St.. the museum will be down the hill 1/2 a block on the right.

Cable cars are an enjoyable and environmentally friendly way to navigate San Francisco. You can catch the cable car at the Embarcadero, Fisherman’s Wharf, or from Market St.

# PARKING

  * The museum does not have on-site parking.
  * There are several public pay par...
